svg.style: background: #ffffff; background-color: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); color-scheme: light dark;

div.b: Why GWAS cannot distinguish causal from tag variants:

switch.text: Why GWAS cannot distinguish causal from tag variants:

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 478px; height: 1px; padding-top: 305px; margin-left: 92px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 9px; font-family: Arial; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
• All variants in the LD block show similar association p-values
• The causal variant (★) and its correlated neighbors are statistically indistinguishable
• GWAS reports the "lead SNP" (lowest p-value), which may be a tag, not the cause

switch.text: • All variants in the LD block show similar association p-values...
